conclusion: To determine when Objects A and B are farthest apart, find the maximum difference in their positions over time.
The y-axis represents velocity (v), and the x-axis represents time (t). Object A and Object B have different velocity profiles over time.
The area under each velocity-time curve gives the position of each object as a function of time.
The difference between these areas at any time t indicates how far apart the objects are.
To find when the objects are farthest apart, identify where the difference in the areas under the curves is the greatest.
The red tangent lines indicate points where the separation rate changes. These are critical points for analysis.
At t2, Object A reaches its peak velocity while Object B's velocity is increasing.
Beyond t2, Object B's velocity exceeds Object A's.
The maximum separation occurs just before Object B's velocity surpasses Object A's, which is at t2.
